intro: Carex atrata var. chalciolepis, commonly known as black sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant features dark green, strap-like leaves and produces spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical structure supports its role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
